qas.question: What year was the first HD video conferencing system displayed?

context: In May <a0_0>2005<a0_0/>, <b5_0>the first high definition video conferencing systems<b5_0/>, produced by <a1_0>LifeSize Communications<a1_0/>, were displayed <b6_0>at the Interop trade show in <a2_0>Las Vegas, Nevada<b6_0/><a2_0/>, able to provide video at 30 frames per second with a <a4_0>1280 by 720<a4_0/> display resolution. <a3_0>Polycom<a3_0/> introduced <b7_0>its first high definition video conferencing system to the market<b7_0/> in 2006. <b8_0>As of the 2010s<b8_0/>, <b9_0>high definition resolution for videoconferencing<b9_0/> became a popular feature, with most major suppliers in the videoconferencing market offering it.
